qas.question: What kind of glass exists in nature?
Obsidian is what type of glass?
What was obsidian used to make in prehistoric times?
When are the oldest beads thought to have been made?
What glass-like material is made with a method related to glazing?
What kind of glass exists in Egypt?
Obsidian is what type of slag?
What was obsidian used to make in falence processes?
What glass-like material is made with a method related to sharp cutting?
What suggests that the first true glass was accidental?

context: Naturally occurring glass, especially the <a1_0><b6_0>volcanic<b6_0/><a1_0/> glass <a0_0><b5_0>obsidian<b5_0/><a0_0/>, has been used by many Stone Age societies across the globe for the production of sharp <a2_0><b7_0>cutting tools<b7_0/><a2_0/> and, due to its limited source areas, was extensively traded. But in general, <b9_0>archaeological evidence<b9_0/> suggests that the first true glass was made in coastal north Syria, Mesopotamia or ancient Egypt. The earliest known glass objects, of the <a3_0>mid third millennium BCE<a3_0/>, were beads, perhaps initially created as accidental by-products of metal-working (slags) or during the production of <a4_0><b8_0>faience<b8_0/><a4_0/>, a pre-glass vitreous material made by a process similar to glazing.
